p: The future linear SST trends found in NEMO are in general agreement with those from the CMIP5 runs (Fig. 1c). Of the five focal hotspots, East Australia shows the fastest warming trend of up to 8 °C for the 2001–2050 time period examined, followed by the South African hotspot (in particular the area of Agulhas retroflection) with warming of up to 4 °C across the 50‐yr period. The warming trends across the rest of the hotspots are approximately 3 °C over the 50‐yr period (cf. 1.3 °C across the 50 years period global mean).
